setQuantity

void setQuantity(java.lang.String quantity)
Set the number of AgentInstances to start. When an AgentInstance is going to start, multiple runnable-models may be created out of this AgentInstance.

Parameters:
quantity - the number of AgentInstances to start.

getQuantity

long getQuantity()
Get the number of AgentInstances to start. When an AgentInstance is going to start, multiple runnable-models may be created out of this AgentInstance.

Returns:
The number of AgentInstances to start.

setNamingScheme

void setNamingScheme(java.lang.String namingScheme)
Set the naming-scheme in case multiple runnable-instances of this AgentInstance should be started. The naming-scheme is used to name the runnables in order to make sure that their names are unique inside the ASCML. The String is appended at the Name of the runnable. You may choose any String you like. There are a few placeholders that might be used in order order to ensure uniqueness of names. '%N' is replaced with an ID, starting by 0 and ascending to the number of runnable models of this type created so far '%T' is replaced at the time of creation of a runnable by the current time in milliseconds '%R' is replaced with a pseudo random-number between 0 and 1,000,000,000 Depending on how much runnable-instances you want to create, you should combine the placeholders. One example for an naming-scheme could be: '%N_(time:%Tms)' ... resulting for example in '%runnableName%_0_(time:109873247ms)'

Parameters:
namingScheme - the naming-scheme used to name runnable AgentInstances in case multiple runnable-instances should be started.

getNamingScheme

java.lang.String getNamingScheme()
Get the naming-scheme in case multiple runnable-instances of this AgentInstance should be started. The naming-scheme is used to name the runnables in order to make sure that their names are unique inside the ASCML. The String is appended at the Name of the runnable. You may choose any String you like. There are a few placeholders that might be used in order order to ensure uniqueness of names. '%N' is replaced with an ID, starting by 0 and ascending to the number of runnable models of this type created so far '%T' is replaced at the time of creation of a runnable by the current time in milliseconds '%R' is replaced with a pseudo random-number between 0 and 1,000,000,000 Depending on how much runnable-instances you want to create, you should combine the placeholders. One example for an naming-scheme could be: '%N_(time:%Tms)' ... resulting for example in '%runnableName%_0_(time:109873247ms)'

Returns:
The naming-scheme used to name runnable AgentInstances in case multiple runnable-instances should be started.

setStatus

void setStatus(java.lang.String newStatus)
Set the status of this model. The status indicates, whether loading was successful or not.

Parameters:
newStatus - The status of this model, possible values are STATUS_OK, STATUS_ERROR, STATUS_REFERENCE_ERROR.

getStatus

java.lang.String getStatus()
Get the status of this model. The status indicates, whether loading was successful or not.

Returns:
The status of this model, possible values are STATUS_OK, STATUS_ERROR, STATUS_REFERENCE_ERROR.

addParameter

void addParameter(IParameter parameter)
Add a parameter to this agent. The parameter overwrites the value of the matching type-parameter of this agent's type. Note: The parameters set within the AgentInstance may only define a name and a value, and overwrite a possible value defined by the parameters of the AgentType.

Parameters:
parameter - The Parameter-object to add.

removeParameter

void removeParameter(java.lang.String parameterName)
Remove a parameter from this agent.

Parameters:
parameterName - The name of the parameter to remove.

getParameter

IParameter getParameter(java.lang.String name)
Get an agent's parameter. When the instance does not overwrite a parametervalue of a parameter, which is already defined by the type, the type's parameter is returned.

Parameters:
name - The name of the Parameter
Returns:
An agent's parameter or null if no parameter with the given name exists.

getParameters

IParameter[] getParameters()
Get all of the agent's parameter. When the instance does not overwrite a parametervalue of a parameter, which is already defined by the type, the type's parameter is returned.

Returns:
All of the agent's parameters as Parameter-Array or null if no parameters exist.

addParameterSet

void addParameterSet(IParameterSet parameterSet)
Add a ParameterSet to this agent. The ParameterSet overwrites the values of the matching type-parameterSet of this agent's type. Note: The parameterSets within the AgentInstance may only define a name and a list of values, and overwrite possible values defined by the ParameterSets of the AgentType.

Parameters:
parameterSet - The ParameterSet-object.

removeParameterSet

void removeParameterSet(java.lang.String parameterSetName)
Remove a parameterSet from this agent.

Parameters:
parameterSetName - The name of the parameterSet to remove.

getParameterSet

IParameterSet getParameterSet(java.lang.String name)
Get an agent's ParameterSet. When the instance does not overwrite parametervalues of a ParameterSet, which is already defined by the type, the type's ParameterSet is returned.

Parameters:
name - The name of the ParameterSet
Returns:
The agent's ParameterSet or null if no ParameterSet with the given name exists.

getParameterSets

IParameterSet[] getParameterSets()
Get all of the agent's parameterSets. When the instance does not overwrite a parameterSet, which is already defined by the type, the type's parameterSet is returned.

Returns:
All of the agent's parameterSets as ParameterSet-Array or null if no parameterSets exist.

throwModelChangedEvent

void throwModelChangedEvent(java.lang.String eventCode)
Throw a ModelChangedEvent notifying all the listeners that this model has been changed. If there are many events thrown in very short time-intervals these events will not be dispatched, if they are of the same kind. Instead a timer counts down and then dispatches one event.

Parameters:
eventCode - The eventCode for the event (see ModelChangedEvent for possible codes)

throwModelChangedEvent

void throwModelChangedEvent(java.lang.String eventCode,
                            java.lang.Object userObject)
Throw a ModelChangedEvent notifying all the listeners that this model has been changed. If there are many events thrown in very short time-intervals these events will not be dispatched, if they are of the same kind. Instead a timer counts down and then dispatches one event.

Parameters:
eventCode - The eventCode for the event (see ModelChangedEvent for possible codes)
userObject - This object is stored in the ModelChangedEvent. For example: When runnables are added or removed, these RunnableModels are stored as userObjects to access them later on.

toString

java.lang.String toString()
This method returns a short String with the agentInstance-name. It is used by the RepositoryTree for example, to name the nodes.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
String containing the name of this agentInstance

toFormattedString

java.lang.String toFormattedString()
This method returns a formatted String showing the agentInstance-model.

Returns:
formatted String showing ALL information about this agentInstance.
